results.title: Efficacy and safety of atenolol versus propranolol for treatment of infantile haemangioma: A narrative review.
results.text_hl: Hence, @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, a hydrophilic @GENE_MS4A1 @GENE_931 @@@beta-1@@@ selective blocker, has demonstrated similar efficacy and potentially greater tolerability, being less likely to cause @<m>DISEASE_Sleep_Wake_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012893 @@@sleep disturbances@@@ given its inability to cross the blood brain barrier, and a decrease in bronchial reactivity.

citations.NLM: Shi M, Wargon O, Tatian A. Efficacy and safety of atenolol versus propranolol for treatment of infantile haemangioma: A narrative review. Clin Exp Dermatol. 2024 Oct 4;():. PMID: 39365598
citations.BibTeX: @article{39365598, title={Efficacy and safety of atenolol versus propranolol for treatment of infantile haemangioma: A narrative review.}, author={Shi M and Wargon O and Tatian A}, journal={Clin Exp Dermatol}}

results.title: Oral atenolol therapy for proliferating infantile hemangioma
results.text_hl: Before starting @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, each child underwent echocardiography to exclude contraindications to @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ treatment.

citations.NLM: Ji Y, Wang Q, Chen S, Xiang B, Xu Z, Li Y, Zhong L, Jiang X, Yang X. Oral atenolol therapy for proliferating infantile hemangioma Medicine (Baltimore). 2016 Jun;95(24):e3908. PMID: 27310994
citations.BibTeX: @article{27310994, title={Oral atenolol therapy for proliferating infantile hemangioma}, author={Ji Y and Wang Q and Chen S and Xiang B and Xu Z and Li Y and Zhong L and Jiang X and Yang X}, journal={Medicine (Baltimore)}, volume={95}, number={24}, pages={e3908}}

results.title: Atenolol as an alternative to propranolol for the management of sleep disturbances in the treatment of infantile hemangiomas.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@ as an alternative to @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@ for the management of @<m>DISEASE_Sleep_Wake_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012893 @@@sleep disturbances@@@ in the treatment of @DISEASE_Hemangioma_capillary_infantile @DISEASE_MESH:C535860 @@@infantile hemangiomas@@@.

citations.NLM: Gumina ME, Yan AC. Atenolol as an alternative to propranolol for the management of sleep disturbances in the treatment of infantile hemangiomas. Pediatr Dermatol. 2019 Jul;36(4):556-557. PMID: 30983047
citations.BibTeX: @article{30983047, title={Atenolol as an alternative to propranolol for the management of sleep disturbances in the treatment of infantile hemangiomas.}, author={Gumina ME and Yan AC}, journal={Pediatr Dermatol}, volume={36}, number={4}, pages={556-557}}

results.title: Atenolol versus pindolol: side-effects in hypertension.
results.text_hl: As the study progressed there was a reduction in the frequency of @DISEASE_Fatigue @DISEASE_MESH:D005221 @@@fatigue@@@ (p less than 0.03) and dreams (p less than 0.05) in both groups, whereas @<m>DISEASE_Sleep_Wake_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012893 @@@sleep disturbances@@@ significantly increased under @CHEMICAL_Pindolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D010869 @@@pindolol@@@ (p less than 0.05) but decreased under @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ (p less than 0.05).

citations.NLM: Foerster EC, Greminger P, Siegenthaler W, Vetter H, Vetter W. Atenolol versus pindolol: side-effects in hypertension. Eur J Clin Pharmacol. 1985;28 Suppl():89-91. PMID: 4054195
citations.BibTeX: @article{4054195, title={Atenolol versus pindolol: side-effects in hypertension.}, author={Foerster EC and Greminger P and Siegenthaler W and Vetter H and Vetter W}, journal={Eur J Clin Pharmacol}, volume={28 Suppl}, pages={89-91}}

results.title: Comparison of the side-effects of pindolol and atenolol in the treatment of hypertension.
results.text_hl: After 1 month there was significantly less @DISEASE_Bradycardia @DISEASE_MESH:D001919 @@@bradycardia@@@ (P less than 0.01), cold hands and feet (P less than 0.05) and tiredness (P less than 0.02) in the @CHEMICAL_Pindolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D010869 @@@pindolol@@@ group, and less @<m>DISEASE_Sleep_Wake_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012893 @@@sleep disturbance@@@ (P less than 0.02) in the @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ group.

citations.NLM: Abrahamsen AM, Digranes O, Gisholt K. Comparison of the side-effects of pindolol and atenolol in the treatment of hypertension. J Intern Med. 1990 Sep;228(3):219-22. PMID: 2205704
citations.BibTeX: @article{2205704, title={Comparison of the side-effects of pindolol and atenolol in the treatment of hypertension.}, author={Abrahamsen AM and Digranes O and Gisholt K}, journal={J Intern Med}, volume={228}, number={3}, pages={219-22}}

results.title: Sleep-related changes in cardiovascular autonomic regulation in left coronary artery ligation rats: Neural mechanism facilitating arrhythmia after myocardial infarction.
results.text_hl: CONCLUSIONS: Our results demonstrate significant @DISEASE_Sleep_Deprivation @DISEASE_MESH:D012892 @@@sleep fragmentations@@@ with @DISEASE_Hyperkinesis @DISEASE_MESH:D006948 @@@sympathetic hyperactivity@@@ during QS stages after MI, and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ could restore the @DISEASE_Autonomic_Nervous_System_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D001342 @@@autonomic dysfunction@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Sleep_Wake_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012893 @@@sleep disturbance@@@.

citations.NLM: Lin WL, Lo LW, Chen HR, Lai CT, Yamada S, Liu SH, Chou YH, Chen SA, Fu YC, Kuo TB. Sleep-related changes in cardiovascular autonomic regulation in left coronary artery ligation rats: Neural mechanism facilitating arrhythmia after myocardial infarction. Int J Cardiol. 2016 Dec 15;225():65-72. PMID: 27710806
citations.BibTeX: @article{27710806, title={Sleep-related changes in cardiovascular autonomic regulation in left coronary artery ligation rats: Neural mechanism facilitating arrhythmia after myocardial infarction.}, author={Lin WL and Lo LW and Chen HR and Lai CT and Yamada S and Liu SH and Chou YH and Chen SA and Fu YC and Kuo TB}, journal={Int J Cardiol}, volume={225}, pages={65-72}}

results.title: Melatonin secretion related to side-effects of beta-blockers from the central nervous system.
results.text_hl: After 4 weeks of treatment all beta-blockers reduced @CHEMICAL_Melatonin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008550 @@@melatonin@@@ excretion, but the effect was significant only for @CHEMICAL_Metoprolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008790 @@@metoprolol@@@. @<m>DISEASE_Sleep_Wake_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012893 @@@Sleep disturbance@@@ records revealed more disturbed nights in the @CHEMICAL_Metoprolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008790 @@@metoprolol@@@ group compared with the @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@ and the @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ groups, even when the difference in age between the groups was controlled for.

citations.NLM: Brismar K, Hylander B, Eliasson K, Rössner S, Wetterberg L. Melatonin secretion related to side-effects of beta-blockers from the central nervous system. Acta Med Scand. 1988;223(6):525-30. PMID: 3291558
citations.BibTeX: @article{3291558, title={Melatonin secretion related to side-effects of beta-blockers from the central nervous system.}, author={Brismar K and Hylander B and Eliasson K and Rössner S and Wetterberg L}, journal={Acta Med Scand}, volume={223}, number={6}, pages={525-30}}

results.title: Beta-blockers and central nervous system side effects.
results.text_hl: However, within this group of four drugs the incidence of these side effects is lowest with hydrophilic @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ and generally highest with @CHEMICAL_Pindolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D010869 @@@pindolol@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@.

citations.NLM: McAinsh J, Cruickshank JM. Beta-blockers and central nervous system side effects. Pharmacol Ther. 1990;46(2):163-97. PMID: 1969642
citations.BibTeX: @article{1969642, title={Beta-blockers and central nervous system side effects.}, author={McAinsh J and Cruickshank JM}, journal={Pharmacol Ther}, volume={46}, number={2}, pages={163-97}}
